sentences.en: Acting is definitely a young person's profession in many ways.
sentences.cn: 从许多方面来说，表演无疑是吃青春饭的行当。

sentences.en: an unholy alliance between the medical profession and the pharmaceutical industry
sentences.cn: 医疗界与医药业的不当联盟

sentences.en: Catching colds is unfortunately an occupational hazard in this profession.
sentences.cn: 不幸的是，容易感冒是这个行业的职业性风险。

sentences.en: Harper was a teacher by profession.
He deprecated the low quality of entrants to the profession.
sentences.cn: 他对该行业中新人的低素质予以了批评。

sentences.en: He did well in his chosen profession.
sentences.cn: 他在自己选择的行业里干得不错。

sentences.en: He made a profession of friendship to his classmate Mary.
sentences.cn: 他向他的同学玛丽表白了他的友情.

sentences.en: nurses, social workers, and other people in the caring professions
sentences.cn: 护士、社工和其他从事护理行业的人

sentences.en: people who work in the professions
Research is the corner-stone of the profession.
sentences.cn: 研究是这一职业的基础。

sentences.en: She eventually decided the acting profession wasn't half bad.
sentences.cn: 她最终断定，表演这一行并不适合。

sentences.en: Spanish identity documents state the bearer's profession.
sentences.cn: 西班牙的身份证件会注明证件持有者的职业。

sentences.en: The attitude of the medical profession is very much more liberal now.
sentences.cn: 现在，医务人员的态度开明多了。

sentences.en: The depth of covert racism in my own profession frightens me.
sentences.cn: 我所从事的职业中暗藏着如此深的种族主义偏见，这让我感到害怕。

sentences.en: The ethics of his profession don't permit him to do that.
sentences.cn: 他的职业道德不允许他那样做.

sentences.en: The legal profession is starting to be less elitist and more representative.
sentences.cn: 法律行业正开始变得更具平民性，不像从前那么精英化。

sentences.en: The proportion of women in the profession had risen to 17.3%.
sentences.cn: 从事该职业的女性比例已升高到17.3%。

专业的；职业的；职业性的
在表面上；公然地；专业地
专业主义；专家的地位；特性或方法
教授；教师；公开表示信仰的人
声称；断言；伪称（profess的过去分词）
自称；公开表示；宣称信奉；正式准予加入

trans.tran_cn: 职业，业内人士，全体人员，声明
trans.tran_en: a job that needs a high level of education and training
